keyTakeAways: Ian Roberts, a former superintendent of Des Moines Public Schools, was indicted by a federal grand jury for falsely claiming U.S. citizenship on an I-9 form and for illegally possessing firearms.
Roberts, originally from Guyana, worked in school districts for two decades before being hired in 2023 to lead Des Moines Public Schools, the largest in Iowa.
He was detained by ICE on September 26, 2023, fled in a district-issued Jeep Cherokee, and was later found with a handgun wrapped in a towel in a wooded area.
A federal indictment alleges that Roberts made a false attestation on an I-9 form, claiming to be a U.S. citizen when he was not.
After an immigration judge issued a final removal order, an appeal was rejected earlier in 2025, confirming his status as an illegal alien.
Three additional firearms were found during a search of his home, including two pistols, a rifle, and a shotgun, bringing the total number of weapons to four.
The Des Moines Public Schools district filed a lawsuit against the consulting firm it used in the 2023 superintendent search, citing concerns over improper hiring practices.

Jackie Norris, school board chair, proposed a review of Roberts’ expenditures after an AP investigation revealed that his hiring was facilitated through a firm that marketed him as a consultant. She later ended her U.S. Senate campaign.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ian Roberts, the former superintendent of Des Moines Public Schools, has been indicted by a federal grand jury for falsely claiming U.S. citizenship on an I-9 form and for unlawfully possessing firearms while in the country illegally. Originally from Guyana, Roberts worked in school districts across the U.S. for two decades before being hired in 2023. He was detained by ICE on September 26, 2023, after fleeing in a district-issued vehicle, where agents found a handgun wrapped in a towel. A federal indictment alleges he made a false attestation on an I-9 form and was in possession of four firearms—two pistols, a rifle, and a shotgun—after being found in a wooded area. Authorities previously rejected an appeal to reopen immigration proceedings, confirming his status as an illegal alien. The school district has filed a lawsuit against the consulting firm it used in the 2023 hiring process, citing concerns about improper promotion of Roberts. School board chair Jackie Norris initiated a review of Roberts’ expenditures and later ended her campaign for the U.S. Senate, highlighting public and political fallout from the incident.
title: Iowa Superintendent Detained by ICE Falsely Claimed He Was a US Citizen, Indictment Says
